info.title: Agent API
info.description:
The Agent API allows AI agents to take direct action in Sitecore through secure REST endpoints. It supports common digital experience tasks such as creating pages, adding components, and updating content.

As part of Sitecore's [*interoperability*](https://doc.sitecore.com/xmc/en/users/xm-cloud/integrating-sitecore-with-agentic-platforms.html) approach, the Agent API allows agentic platforms and other connected systems to interact directly with Sitecore. When an AI agent receives a natural language request, it can call the appropriate Agent API endpoints to complete the task. For example, a request to create a new landing page might trigger an endpoint in Sitecore that automatically builds the page. If the AI agent performs an unintended action, you can use the job ID to revert it. Each operation is tracked to ensure safe rollback when needed.

All Agent API actions follow the built-in security and approval rules in Sitecore, keeping work safe, traceable, and auditable.

In addition to AI agent-driven workflows, developers can also use the REST API directly to interact with the following objects:

- **Sites** - retrieve and manage sites and their pages.
- **Pages** - create and manage pages and components.
- **Content** - create and organize content items.
- **Components** - retrieve and manage components and datasources.
- **Assets** - upload and manage digital assets.
- **Environments** - retrieve environment and language details.
- **Personalization** - manage personalized content variants.
- **Jobs** - view or revert job operations.


Note the following:

- To use this REST API, you authenticate your API requests.
- All API requests are made in your production environment.

The Agent API also powers the Marketer MCP, which uses these endpoints to perform agentic operations in Sitecore. Read more about the [Marketer MCP](https://doc.sitecore.com/xmc/en/users/xm-cloud/marketer-mcp.html/).

# Authorization
 To authorize your requests, use environment automation client credentials and generate a JSON Web Token (JWT). You can also register an OAuth app if your integration requires the OAuth 2.0 authorization code flow.

Note: To create client credentials, you must be an [Organization Admin](https://doc.sitecore.com/portal/en/developers/sitecore-cloud-portal/roles.html) or Organization Owner.

## Create an automation client
 1. In the Sitecore Cloud Portal, open XM Cloud Deploy.
 2. Click **Credentials** > **Environment** > **Create credentials** > **Automation**.
 3. Fill out the automation client details, then click **Create**.
 4. Copy the client ID and the client secret because you won't be able to view them again in XM Cloud Deploy. You'll use them to request a JWT.

## Register an OAuth app for the Agent API 
The Agent API uses the OAuth 2.0 authorization code flow to securely authenticate requests from external applications.

 Each application must have an OAuth app registration, which identifies the app and defines the parts of the Sitecore platform it can access. 

 If you plan to register an OAuth app that uses the Agent API, you must submit a registration request to Sitecore Support and request the following scopes:
 - `xmcloud.cm:admin` 
 - `personalize.exp:mng` 
 - `personalize.tmpl:r` 
 - `personalize.pos:mng`   
## Request a JWT

Run the following cURL command to request a JWT. Replace the placeholder values with your client ID and client secret.

```curl
  curl -X POST 'https://auth.sitecorecloud.io/oauth/token' \
  --header 'Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded' \ 
  --data-urlencode 'client_id={YOUR_CLIENT_ID}' \
  --data-urlencode 'client_secret={YOUR_CLIENT_SECRET}' \
  --data-urlencode 'grant_type=client_credentials' \
  --data-urlencode 'audience=https://api.sitecorecloud.io'
```

In the response, the `access_token` key contains the JWT:

```json
  {
    "access_token": "{YOUR_JWT}",
    "scope": "xmcloud.cm:admin",
    "expires_in": 86400,
    "token_type": "Bearer"
  }
```

The JWT expires in 24 hours. If your requests unexpectedly return a response with status `401 Unauthorized`, request a new JWT by repeating this `POST` request.

We recommend that you cache the JWT for 24 hours to avoid repeating this `POST` request while the JWT is still valid.

## Include the JWT in the request header

You can now start making REST API requests. You must include the JWT in the request header of every request. For example:
```curl
  curl -X GET '{YOUR_BASE_URL}/...' \
  -H 'Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_JWT}' \
  -H 'Accept: application/json'
```

tags.name: Sites
tags.description: The Sites API lets you retrieve all sites, retrieve details about a specific site, list pages of a site, and retrieve a site ID associated with an item ID.

tags.name: Pages
tags.description: The Pages API lets you create new pages, add new language versions or components to a page, search for pages on a site, set the component datasource on a page, retrieve page components, paths, HTML, preview URL, screenshots, templates, details, and allowed components.

tags.name: Content
tags.description: The Content API lets you create, retrieve, update, delete and organize structured content items, and retrieve insert options.

tags.name: Components
tags.description: The Components API lets you retrieve components, get the details of a specific component, search datasources in a component, and create a component datasource.

tags.name: Assets
tags.description: The Assets API lets you upload, search assets, retrieve asset details, and update asset metadata.

tags.name: Environments
tags.description: The Environments API lets you retrieve available languages in your environment.

tags.name: Personalization
tags.description: The Personalization API lets you create personalized variants for different audiences by showing targeted content based on certain conditions.

tags.name: Jobs
tags.description: The Jobs API lets you retrieve all details and operations of a specific job or revert a job to undo changes made during an operation.

get.description: Retrieves a list of available sites with their basic information including name, display name, and URL.

parameters.name: x-sc-job-id

schema.description: A unique identifier for the job, used to trace, audit, and revert actions performed by an AI agent through the Agent API.
schema.title: X-Sc-Job-Id

parameters.description: A unique identifier for the job, used to trace, audit, and revert actions performed by an AI agent through the Agent API.

parameters.name: x-sc-job-id

schema.description: A unique identifier for the job, used to trace, audit, and revert actions performed by an AI agent through the Agent API.

schema.title: Response Sites-Get All Pages By Site

parameters.name: itemId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the item.

parameters.name: x-sc-job-id

schema.description: A unique identifier for the job, used to trace, audit, and revert actions performed by an AI agent through the Agent API.
schema.title: X-Sc-Job-Id

parameters.description: A unique identifier for the job, used to trace, audit, and revert actions performed by an AI agent through the Agent API.

post.description: Creates a new page using the specified template under the parent page. You can set field values and the language for the new page.

schema.description: A unique identifier for the job, used to trace, audit, and revert actions performed by an AI agent through the Agent API.

parameters.description: A unique identifier for the job, used to trace, audit, and revert actions performed by an AI agent through the Agent API.

post.summary: Add a language version to a page
post.description: Adds a new language version for an existing page. This allows you to have the same page content available in multiple languages.

parameters.name: pageId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the page.

parameters.name: x-sc-job-id

schema.description: Job ID for auditing purposes
schema.title: X-Sc-Job-Id

parameters.description: A unique identifier for the job, used to trace, audit, and revert actions performed by an AI agent through the Agent API.

post.summary: Add a component to a page

parameters.name: pageId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the page.

parameters.name: x-sc-job-id

schema.description: A unique identifier for the job, used to trace, audit, and revert actions performed by an AI agent through the Agent API.

parameters.description: A unique identifier for the job, used to trace, audit, and revert actions performed by an AI agent through the Agent API.

schema.title: Version

get.summary: Search for pages on a site
get.description: Searches for all  pages in a specific site using a search term that matches page titles and content. The response returns the matching pages with their details including the page ID, path, and name.

parameters.name: search_query
parameters.description: The search term to look for in page titles and content.

parameters.name: site_name
parameters.description: The unique name of the site to search within.

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: The language code for filtering pages.

parameters.name: x-sc-job-id

schema.description: A unique identifier for the job, used to trace, audit, and revert actions performed by an AI agent through the Agent API.
schema.title: X-Sc-Job-Id

parameters.description: A unique identifier for the job, used to trace, audit, and revert actions performed by an AI agent through the Agent API.

parameters.description: A unique identifier for the job, used to trace, audit, and revert actions performed by an AI agent through the Agent API.

componentRenderingId.title: Componentrenderingid
componentRenderingId.description: The unique identifier of the component rendering definition.

placeholderPath.title: Placeholderpath
placeholderPath.description: The path of the placeholder where the component will be placed.

componentItemName.title: Componentitemname
componentItemName.description: The name of the component item to create.

language.title: Language
language.description: The language code for the component.

fields.title: Fields
fields.description: Field values to set on the component or its datasource.

componentId.title: Componentid
componentId.description: The unique identifier of the newly added component.

pageId.title: Pageid
pageId.description: The unique identifier of the page to which the component was added.

placeholderId.title: Placeholderid
placeholderId.description: The unique identifier of the placeholder where the component was placed.

datasourceId.title: Datasourceid
datasourceId.description: The unique identifier of the datasource used by the component, if applicable.

language.title: Language
language.description: The language code of the new version to add.

success.title: Success
success.description: Whether the language version was added successfully.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the allowed child template.

templateId.title: Templateid
templateId.description: The unique identifier of the allowed child template.

width.title: Width
width.description: The width of the asset in pixels, or null if not applicable.

height.title: Height
height.description: The height of the asset in pixels, or null if not applicable.

format.title: Format
format.description: The file format of the asset (e.g., jpg, png), or null if not applicable.

alt_text.title: Alt Text
alt_text.description: Alternative text for the asset, or null if not provided.
alt_text.example: A beautiful sunset over the mountains.

id.title: Id
id.description: The unique identifier of the asset.

type.title: Type
type.description: The type of asset, for example, image or document.

url.title: Url
url.description: The URL where the asset can be accessed.

size.title: Size
size.description: The size of the asset in bytes.

innerItem.description: Details about the inner item if the asset is a container item.

alt.title: Alt
alt.description: Alternative text for the asset, or null if not provided.
alt.example: A beautiful sunset over the mountains.

width.title: Width
width.description: The width of the asset in pixels, or null if not applicable.

height.title: Height
height.description: The height of the asset in pixels, or null if not applicable.

templateId.description: The unique identifier of the template used by the asset.

templateName.description: The name of the template used by the asset.

file.title: File
file.description: The file to upload as an asset. You must select a file from your local machine.

upload_request.title: Upload Request
upload_request.description:
A JSON string containing the following parameters for uploading an asset: 
 -  `name` - the name of the asset. 
 
 - `itemPath` - the path to the asset. 

 - `language` - the language code of the asset. 
 
 - `extension` - the asset's file extension. 
 
 - `siteName` - the name of the site. process.

 JSON structure with example values: 

 ```json
{
 "name":  "{YOUR_ASSETNAME}.jpg",
 "itemPath": "/sitecore/Media Library/Images",
"language": "en",
 "extension": "jpg",
 "siteName": "skate-park"
}
